text:list-header.text:p: → Need neutrino event generator for KLG4

draw:text-box.text:p: What Tools are Needed to Study High Energy ν Ineractions?

text:list-item.text:p: Nuance and GENIE cross-sections seem to be consistent.
Currently GENIE has better support and is actively developed.

draw:text-box.text:p: Calculated Atmospheric Neutrino Spectrum and Fit for Kamioka Mine

text:p.text:span: Honda et al. Improvement of low energy atmospheric neutrino flux calculation using the JAM nuclear interaction model Phys. Rev. D 83, 123001 (2011) [34 pages]

draw:text-box.text:p: Neutrino Directionality:Center of Sqrt of Charge

text:p.text:span: Vector from “center of 1/time” to “center of sqrt(charge)” is a good and quick estimate of particle direction.

draw:text-box.text:p: Disagreement of This Fitter from KAT Muon Fitter(muon from RTQ run 5000~5099)

text:list-item.text:p: Prepulsing of PMTs near entry/exit points giving strange first hit times when calculating “center of 1/time”?
Fitter agreement Improved by placing cut on PMTs with high first hit PE when calculating “center of 1/time”.

draw:text-box.text:p: Zenith Angle of Both Fitters(muons from RTQ run 5000~5099)

text:list-item.text:p: Muon Fitter is fitting through-going muons well.
New fitter is less accurate for through going muons..

text:p.text:span: ν event generators were compared, and GENIE was selected.
Fully contained atmospheric neutrino directionality achieved in KLG4Sim.
T2K ν direction reconstruction tried with Muon fitter and new fitter.

text:list-item.text:p: Use GENIE neutrino spectrum with finer bins.
Combine advantages of both fitters to achieve

text:list-header.text:p: good directionality in FC, PC, through-going events.
